data.title: Railway Stations Without Tracks!
data.meta_description:
Cleckheaton Spen. 
Stamford Bridge (Yorkshire) is on a public cycle way/ footpath 

Sent from my 4009X using Tapatalk
data.text:
I believe West Bay in Dorset still has it's station.

Sent from my Lumia 625 using Tapatalk

Indeed it does (it's a café) and so does Powerstock on the same line (private house - the owner has been there since before the line closed)

And on the Meon Valley line Droxford and Privett still have their station buildings (which is more than West Meon does)

Indeed it does (it's a café) and so does Powerstock on the same line (private house - the owner has been there since before the line closed)

And on the Meon Valley line Droxford and Privett still have their station buildings (which is more than West Meon does)

Will have to go down to Powerstock some time to have a look, been near there so many times but didn't realise it still had it's station.

I also believe chard town station building is still there (near B&Q), and also Sturminster Newton station might still be there (adjacent to the main car park)

And although it does still have tracks a place that seems to have retained it's station (and platform) is Seaton Junction.

How about the (real) GWR station in Devon (Brixham? Kingswear?) that never had tracks? Only ever saw boats.

Dartmouth.

It had a station building with a booking office, but nearest trains (and track) were on the other side of the river at Kingswear!

--- old post above --- --- new post below ---

The trainshed was demolished a long time ago and the Callaghan Labour Govt started building a Govt Office there (it was abandoned when Thatcher won in 1979).

Now its the site of a Morrisons supermarket

Link here : http://www.disused-stations.org.uk/s/southport_lord_street/index.shtml

Re: Southport (Lord Street).

The frontage survives, forming (part of) a Travelodge. I have actually stayed in one of the rooms in the original clock tower, which was nice!
